description: Students explore French-speaking regions of the world outside France through the close
reading, discussion, and analysis of literary and non-literary texts as well as other
cultural artifacts. Readings, discussions, viewings, and written and oral assignments are
organized around the exploration of specific topics or themes. May be repeated if
geographical region is different. Taught in French.
Counts toward Africa and the Americas concentration when topic is Francophone Africa and counts
Prerequisite: minimum of one 250-level course (two recommended).
